website_summaries.verdict: While it has some quality concerns typical to this type of scooter, it also has unique features and a reasonable build that will thrill most young riders.
pros: Stands out for its cool blue lights that glow while riding it
This mid-level scooter travels up to 10 mph and gets decent battery life
cons: Reliability issues include a chain that tends to come loose and fall off, tires that won't hold enough air, and failure to start altogether
Battery takes a while to charge

customer_reviews.title: A boat load of fun for the 9 year old grandson
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson on his 9 year old birthday. He absolutely loves this scooter. It lights up when the power is on, making it extra cool. It moves at a great speed for a 9 year old, fast enough to be thrilling, but not outrageous or scary fast. We took it up to the local destination KOA and he road it up and down the gravel road. The one downside (why not a 5 star) is it takes up to 12 hours to fully charge when depleted. It says it will provide 45 minutes of continuous operation. Practically, he can run the scooter for a couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: JPW

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Scooter
customer_reviews.text: We so love this, its awesome !!!! Remember you must jump start this before the motor kicks in, but when it does.....get ready to ride !! Its just to much fun.....I would recommend this to anyone for a 9 year old or older......
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this! Bought it as his 10th ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this! Bought it as his 10th birthday present. Takes a little getting use too since it's kick to start. You have to hold the throttle and start to kick then the motor kicks in. He loves the blue glow and he's been outside on it everyday since he's got it. It does deliver I'm the original box though, I gave it to him early because he come home to it on the porch...
customer_reviews.author: Cassy T.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time or money
customer_reviews.text: Returned the first one bc it quit working, only to receive a second one and the chain keeps popping and binding and the tensioner broke after only using it a few times

customer_reviews.title: He zips around on it and has a good time. Was easy to put together upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new scooter. He zips around on it and has a good time. Was easy to put together upon arrival. You do have to charge it for at least 12 hours before you can ride it. My son was very disappointed that he had to wait until the next day to try it out. Also, you have to push with your foot (like on a non electric scooter) to get it going. Needs to get up to 3 MPH to engage the engine but then you take off.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Dead Out of the Box!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my daughter for Christmas. The motor wouldn’t run. The instructions say don’t return it instead open it up and poke around inside to look for loose connections. Guess this is a common thing. I did that but found nothing and it still doesn’t work. Have initiated a return with Amazon and they are sending a replacement. However Amazon does not allow shipping of items with batteries. So now I’m concerned I’ll be billed twice. All in all not a great Christmas Day experience for my daughter and not a good in line shopper no experience for me. I think these things have quality issues. Suggest you avoid them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these for my daughter, age 8, and one for my son, age 11, and they both love it. I'm a grown man and can ride it too a bit, so there's plenty of power in these, though they really are geared for medium sized kids. They're well made, easy to put together upon unwrapping, and the battery life is a good half hour. Highly recommended. The light up glow is great at dusk.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Seufert Photography

customer_reviews.title: Please read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: FYI. You have to push the scooter a few times before the battery kicks on. Can’t just twist the handle and go. I think some people don’t read the instructions
customer_reviews.author: Adam Newby

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome motorized scooter!
customer_reviews.text: A little over a month in and this thing is pretty great for my 8yo son. We plug it in between each use...and have no issues with the battery thus far. Our only issue occasionally is that the handlebar has to be tightened. Granted our son likes to try to ride this like it's a dirt bike on a BMX track, not sure if basic usage would call for the tightening to be necessary. Overall would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Hartsfield

customer_reviews.title: It's a toy.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm pointing out the obvious...but this is a toy. The motor is pretty noisy and it is probably perfect for ages 5 to 8. If you have a child 9 or older, spend double and get a scooter that they can really enjoy. It is clunky, the charging is very finicky, and my child (10) was a little embarrassed to ride it when her friends were on their Gotrax, Xiaomi, or Phaewo.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: True to some reviews, this scooter quit working on the 5th day. Green light was on but the scooter wouldn’t run. If I had it to do again I’d of listened to the bad reviews and not taken a risk on this scooter.
customer_reviews.author: robjengrace

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ BEFORE BUYING
customer_reviews.text: When purchasing this scooter, you play Russian roulette. Half the reviews say it’s great & has lasted a long time. The other half say it died quickly, or the battery just completely crapped out on them. My nephews were the unfortunate ones who had the battery die on one of them, after only a few months. They charged it when necessary; they didn’t run it down until it completely died. But alas, only 1 works. And the battery life on that one lasts maybe 20 minutes (even after charging for 24hrs!) I’m extremely dissatisfied, and will be getting them better ones for Christmas this year.
customer_reviews.author: David L Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Seems durable, but LOUD
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this thing, and I can’t really see anything wrong with it yet, and we’ve had it about 4 months. My only issue with it is that it’s so LOUD! My other kids have little scooters by hover1 and they are completely silent. I’m gonna say this is the motorcycle of electric scooters...maybe the loudness alerts people that he’s coming, and everyone is safer...? Except he can’t hear me when I yell to him...so that’s a minus.
customer_reviews.author: LaurelLaff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for kids not so much for adults.
customer_reviews.text: We do foster care and our neighbor kids got one of these for christmas. Seeing how much fun this thing is for age 4 and up we scooped on prime day. Love how it keeps them entertained for hours! Get a helmet, elbow knee pad set too (adult sz) trust me you’ll appreciate the safety gear for idiot spouse who tries to act like he’s 10! Plenty of power not enough coordination for 35 and up group.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer sold us someone else’s return
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 of these scooters for our grandkids. One came in a new box and is working great. The other one came about a week later and was not in the same kind of original box. We should have realized it meant it was a return. It looked new though so we just did the minor effort to complete assembly and gave it to our grandson for Xmas. It never started no matter how much we charged it. As always, Amazon is fantastic for returns but a 6 year old doesn’t care about any of that. He just knows he still hasn’t been able to play with his gift. Manufacturer should have never reshipped this item to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Great product

Knee and elbow Pads with a helmet are a must because he has taken a couple slams like a champ. Made walks and trips so much fun because now he wants to go for long walks and killing time is super easy. Just need a little open space! Works really well and we love everything about it! 5 stars!

After the initial overnight charge upon receipt, my daughter rode it for hours over a few days before coming back to me and complaining that the battery was running low. It turned out that she wasn't flipping the switch off after plugging it in, so it was actually running most of those days off the initial charge!

product_meta.title: Razor E100 Glow Electric Scooter
product_meta.description: Ready, set, glow. Kids will streak down the road atop the fun and fast E100 Glow Electric Scooter from Razor. And when the zoom becomes more of a put-put-put, simply recharge the motor for a few hours. One twist of the handle and the blue lights illuminate your way - and everyone will definitely see you coming. With power that lasts up to 40 minutes and speeds up to 10 MPH, you are bound to outlast even the master scooters. Features kick-start, high-torque, chain-driven motor, front, twist-grip acceleration control, hand-operated brake, retractable kick stand, 8" pneumatic front wheel and polyurethane rear wheel. Complete with rechargeable 24V (two 12V) sealed lead acid battery system. Includes E100 scooter, charger and tools. For ages 8 and up. Check your local laws, rules and regulations for any applicable restrictions or guidelines governing the use of this product. Take appropriate safety precautions when using this product. Item is hazmat and non-returnable.
